case_title: Azizia Steel Company Ltd. Jeddah K.S.A vs. Mian Muhammad Nawaz Sharif

accussed_details.name: Mian Muhammad Nawaz Sharif
allegation: Possession of assets disproportionate to known sources of income

accussed_details.name: Hussain Nawaz Sharif
allegation: Failure to appear before the court

accussed_details.name: Hassan Nawaz Sharif
allegation: Failure to appear before the court

complaint_summary: The case involves allegations of corruption and possession of assets disproportionate to known sources of income against Mian Muhammad Nawaz Sharif and his sons, stemming from the Panama Papers leak.
investigation_summary: The Supreme Court of Pakistan directed NAB to file references based on findings from the JIT formed in 2017. The JIT concluded that the accused failed to justify the sources of funds for the assets. MLA requests to UAE and KSA revealed fabricated documents submitted by the accused.
judgment_summary: The court convicted Nawaz Sharif under Section 9(a)(v) of NAO, 1999, for corruption and corrupt practices. He was sentenced to 7 years of rigorous imprisonment, fined Rs. 1.5 billion and $25 million, and disqualified from holding public office for 10 years post-release. Assets of HME were ordered forfeited to the Federal Government.
punishment: 7 years rigorous imprisonment, Rs. 1.5 billion fine, $25 million fine, disqualification from public office for 10 years post-release.
legal_arguments: Prosecution argued Nawaz Sharif was the beneficial owner of ASCL and HME.
Defense claimed remittances were gifts and challenged JIT findings.
Court relied on Section 14(c) of NAO, presuming guilt due to failure to justify assets.

witness_statement.NAB Investigators: Provided evidence of financial discrepancies and fabricated documents.
witness_statement.JIT Members: Submitted findings confirming failure to justify sources of funds.

key_issues: Failure to justify sources of funds

maxims.Presumption of guilt: Section 14(c) of NAO allows presumption of guilt if assets are disproportionate to known sources of income.

legal_terms.Benamidar: Nominee or ostensible owner acting on behalf of the real owner.

words_and_phrases.Disproportionate Assets: Assets exceeding known sources of income.
words_and_phrases.Rigorous Imprisonment: A form of imprisonment involving hard labor.

summary_vector_notes: The case highlights the application of accountability laws to public officeholders, focusing on corruption, disproportionate assets, and the burden of proof under NAO.
